meanings.definition: Desirable or worthy of being desired.
meanings.sent1: The shiny new bike was covetable to all the kids in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The princess wore a covetable gown to the royal ball.
meanings.sent3: The covetable chocolate cake disappeared in seconds at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her covetable talent for painting brought joy to many.
meanings.sent5: The covetable treasure map led to a hidden chest of gold coins.

meanings.definition: Capable of being coveted or desired.
meanings.sent1: The rare gemstone was covetable due to its beauty and rarity.
meanings.sent2: The antique vase was covetable among collectors for its historical significance.
meanings.sent3: The covetable cookies vanished from the jar mysteriously.
meanings.sent4: His covetable skills in negotiation made him a valuable asset to the team.
meanings.sent5: The covetable prize was awarded to the winner of the competition.
